title: Photo of mosque in China and local styles

content.prompt: The photograph above shows a fourteenth century C.E. mosque in the city of Xi’an, central China. This image most clearly supports which of the following conclusions about the spread of Islam?

choices.label: Early Muslim communities in China adopted local architectural styles for their religious buildings.
Political instability in fourteenth-century China encouraged the spread of Islam.
Islam spread to China before Buddhism did.
Early Muslim communities in China disguised their mosques as Confucian academies.

topic.text: 1.2: Developments in Dar al-Islam from c. 1200 to c. 1450
